entry.string: This uses dynamic module settings, i.e. you can add/remove settings for your module dynamically too. But you could use the 'normal' hard-coded approach here as well...
entry.translation: Thees uses dynemeec mudoole-a setteengs, i.i. yuoo cun edd/remufe-a setteengs fur yuoor mudoole-a dynemeecelly tuu. Boot yuoo cuoold use-a zee 'nurmel' herd-cuded eppruech here-a es vell...

entry.string: Note : your users will only be able to override those settings that you make available as user settings
entry.translation: Nute-a : yuoor users veell oonly be-a eble-a tu ooferreede-a thuse-a setteengs thet yuoo meke-a efeeeleble-a es user setteengs
